title: Personal Assistant to the MD Job at Future Moves Recruitment Agency
content:
Future Moves Recruitment Agency is a licensed full-fledged Human Resource Firm with extensive expertise and experience in human capital development and staffing.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Personal Assistant to the MD
Job Location: Abuja (FCT)

About the Role


	We’re looking for a Personal Assistant to support the MD in daily operations.
	This person will be the right hand to the executive—managing calendars, coordinating tasks, and ensuring things don’t slip through the cracks.


Key Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Manage and optimize the MD’s calendar, appointments, and travel plans
	Handle confidential information with utmost discretion
	Act as a liaison between the MD and internal teams, partners, and stakeholders
	Track key deliverables across departments and ensure timely execution
	Draft, edit, and manage official correspondence, reports, and presentations
	Prepare briefing materials, agendas, and notes ahead of meetings
	Coordinate and follow up on decisions made during leadership and strategy meetings
	Help plan and execute internal events, board meetings, and strategy sessions
	Anticipate the MD’s needs and proactively solve operational bottlenecks
	Maintain a clear system for tracking deadlines, goals, and follow-through tasks.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Social Sciences, or related field
	3 - 4 years of experience in an administrative, personal assistant, or executive support role
	Strong organizational and multitasking abilities
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills
	High emotional intelligence, discretion, and professionalism
	Proficient in Google Workspace or Microsoft Office Suite
	Must be willing to relocate to Abuja (accommodation provided).


Salary
N180,000 - N250,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send CV to: recruiter.k@fmragency.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Customer Service Representative Job at FD Naturales
content:
FD Naturales is a multi-faceted company which is both a public health and agro-processing Company which specializes in the production of spices, herbs, essential oils and holistic health services.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Service Representative
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Customer Service Representative (CSR) is responsible for providing excellent customer support by addressing inquiries, resolving complaints, processing orders, and ensuring a seamless client experience.
	The role requires strong communication skills, product and service knowledge, and a commitment to customer satisfaction.  


Job Description


	Process orders from the website accurately, speedily, and efficiently. 
	Serve as the primary point of contact for clients via phone, email, chat, and in-person interactions.
	Maintain records of customer interactions, transactions, and complaints 
	Assist customers with product and service selection based on their needs. 
	Identify opportunities to upsell or cross-sell products and services to meet customer needs. 
	Coordinate logistics by liasing with 3rd party logistics and tracking orders.


Must-Have Requirements 


	Must be a graduate
	Must live within Anthony, Maryland, or its environs.
	Must be able to use spreadsheets & other MS Office applications well
	Must be numeric, able to calculate numbers & keep tidy records
	Must be able to handle daily reporting
	Must have high learning quotient
	Must be available for immediate employment
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Must be techy & conversant with social media communication platforms (Instagram, Facebook, tiktok, Whatsapp)
	Strong problem-solving and conflict resolution abilities
	Ability to multitask and to  work effectively in a high-intensity atmosphere (speed and accuracy are of the essence)
	Must be able to follow instructions, work with excellence & open to correction.  
	Attention to detail and a customer-first mindset
	Ability to upsell & cross-sell
	Ability to generate leads
	Must be fast at typing.


Dress code:


	Business casual.


Work Hours:


	Monday- Friday: 9am-5pm
	Saturday: 10am-2pm.


Salary
N100,000 - N150,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send the following below to: vacancies@fdnaturales.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Application Process:


	Record a 1-minute screen share showing us how you would find product information on our website (www.fdnaturales.com) to answer a client who asked about a product you’re not familiar with
	Open MS Excel or Google Sheets and show us how you would create a basic customer complaint log (Name, Date, Complaint, Status). Record a screen share & show the final table on video.
	Make a 2-minute (max) video of yourself explaining how you would up-sell these 2 products to a prospective client.
	
		Product A: helps general breast health for those without any breast health concerns.
		Product B: helps general breast health, but is particularly helpful for those with breast health concerns.
	
	
	Make a 2-minute (max) video explaining how you meet the MUST-HAVEs of the job opening.
	Upload the videos to a Google Drive folder & share the link to the folder and send to the mail above.


Note


	Do NOT submit any CV.
	We will request for it if your video applications meet our requirements.

title: Shipping Officer Job at Promasidor
content:
Promasidor - We are an African company proud of our heritage and totally committed to the continent. We manufacture, market and sell unique brands which bring practicality and pleasure to millions of consumers across Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Shipping Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Shipping Officer role is responsible for overseeing pre- and post-clearing processes, ensuring full compliance with customs and government agency requirements, and maintaining accurate and up-to-date tracking and reporting of all logistics activities.


Responsibilities


	Interface with third party agents in ensuring timely clearing of shipments from both sea and air ports within the stipulated timeframe.
	Will be responsible for all clearing activities of assigned third party agents and daily follow up on assignment shipments to ensure the ensure clearing process (Pre and Post Clearing) are adhered to.
	Optimize the activities of Third Party service providers and report the evaluation of their performance on a monthly basis.
	Daily monitoring and tracking of shipments in transit to ascertain the arrival time and reporting the transit details regularly.
	Regular follow up with both internal and external stakeholders for required clearing documentation and checking correctness.
	The officer must be familiar with all customs, NAFDAC, SON related activities and must be able to resolve issues relating to these government agencies.
	Timely follow up with third party agents for shipment assessment and prepare the duty payment schedule.
	Check to ensure that all shipments have necessary import permit as soon as pre-alert notice is given.
	Will be responsible for the processing and follow up of duty payment to receive duty receipt within 48 hours.
	Ensure timely preparation of NAFDAC costing and processing of payments to obtain draft (in 24 hours) by ensuring correctness of information.
	Timely processing of received shipment PFI for SONCAP online processing, payment and activation.
	Verification of invoices to identify availability of refunds and the processing of the refunds from both shipping lines and terminals.
	Submission of monthly reports on all import related activities.
	Must be familiar with the export process and will be involved in all export activities for Promasidor Nigeria Limited.


Requirements


	Minimum of Bachelors degree (B.Sc)
	At least three years of experience in related field
	Knowledge of PBI will be an added advantage


Key Compentencies:


	Must be familiar with freight forwarding and clearing process in Nigeria.
	Must be able to resolve simple and complex problems relating to work with government agencies like the NAFDAC, SON, NCS etc.
	Must be familiar with shipping documents and be able to identify errors (If any).

title: Team Manager - Merchant Lending Job at FairMoney
content:
FairMoney is building the leading mobile bank for emerging markets. We started with a digital microcredit application on Android, and currently roll out additional financial services (current account, savings, debit card) while expanding the product to Western Africa and South-East Asia.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Team Manager - Merchant Lending

Job Location: Nigeria

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Team Manager will Manage with effectiveness and efficiency, a team portfolio of customers with the strict minimum risk acceptance level by selling the different products of the company.
	The Por supervisor remains responsible of the portfolio activities of his/her team from promotion, loan assessment, disbursement collection and complete recovery.
	He/she is also responsible for having a good relationship with FairMoney's clients and encourage them to buy all the products they are qualified for.


Key Responsibilities
Loan Officer Supervision:


	Manage Team of Portfolio managers play a team leadership role that motivates team members to achieve excellence
	Ensure that individual loan officers on team meet monthly disbursement objectives
	Ensure that individual loan officers on team meet monthly quality targets by maintaining a very strict minimum risk level
	Monitor performance to make sure that every team member is performing to the optimum level and ensure that the policy and procedures are respected
	Conduct pre-disbursement field visits with loan officers on team
	Monitor daily repayment
	Support loan officers with loan recovery, client acquisition
	Approving loans when approval authorities are granted
	Assessing periodically the performance of his/her team member for decision making
	Support the area manager or the state manager in building a good working environment
	Represent the institution towards active and potential partners with dignity and pride


Training:


	Provide regular training for loan officers on team
	Coach and mentor loan officers


Reporting:


	Prepare daily reports on individual loan officer performance
	Other tasks as assigned


Requirements


	HND/Bachelor's Degree in Sales and Marketing or related fields
	A minimum of 6 years of experience in Loan Sales / Portfolio Management and team management
	Ability to motivate a team of Sales Managers for performance
	Extremely flexible, result-oriented, and hardworking with a strong track record of success
	Ability to self-motivate and manage self
	Good communication and interpersonal skills
	High level of integrity
	Dynamic and motivated and individuals who like to work outdoors
	Target Driven.


Benefits


	Private Health Insurance
	Performance Bonus
	Pension Plan
	Training & Development.


Recruitment Process


	A screening call with a member of the recruitment team for 30 minutes
	Technical interview with the hiring manager for 30 to 60 minutes.
